divs: sighting detailsi attended an airshow at the new garden flying field on saturday, august 24, 2013. a friend, his wife, and i had set up lawn chairs at the far southwest area of the field to watch the show. my camera is a canon eos 5d mark iii with a canon ef 70-200mm f\2.8l is ii usm autofocus lens. at exactly 1 p.m. i was photographing an aerobatic biplane doing his routine. after 2 or 3 shots, while looking through the viewfinder, i thought i saw an object in the smoke trail of the plane. i thought perhaps something had fallen from the plane. i figured it hadnt come from inside the plane as it had an enclosed cockpit. as the plane moved off to the side i took several more shots of the smoke trail just to be sure i caught whatever it was i originally saw. i then turned to ask my friend if he was seeing this too but he was talking to his wife so i turned back to take some more pictures but i could no longer find the object. since the screen is too small on my camera to see properly, i waited until i got home to review my pictures. it was then that i noticed a sphere at the very bottom of the first picture almost directly in a line beneath the plane and rising a bit higher in the second picture. in the third picture, the sphere can be seen now above the biplane. this was all in a matter of about 5 or 6 seconds. the remaining shots of just the smoke trail appear to show the object begin to flatten out into more of a disk shape. it was at that point that i lost sight of the object. i showed the emailed the pictures to my friend and he replied that he also thought he saw a glimpse of something during the routine but he wasnt sure what it was. when i first looked at the pictures i thought it might be some sort of weather balloon but that air space was restricted during the show and it would be more than foolish to release a balloon during that kind of event. also, i felt that the object ascended much faster than i would suspect a balloon might and when it reached an altitude above the biplane it seemed to stop rising. thats when it appeared to become disk shaped and move to the left.
Summary: Noticed sphere while taking photos of aerobatic plane at airshow.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Toughkenamon
This sighting has never been favorited.
